intro: Microcos ovatolanceolata, commonly known as the broadleaf microcos, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its ovate to lanceolate leaves that are typically smooth and have a slightly waxy texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale pink to white in color. It is native to parts of Africa and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Microcos ovatolanceolata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
